Can you elaborate on this?  I have tested the JBuilder TestRunner and it 
works fine with JUnit 3.8, becuase JBuilder uses TestSuite to load the 
tests, just like the other test runners in JUnit.

If you want to upgrade, there are two ways to do it:
1. Create a library for JUnit 3.8 (you can call it JUnit 3.8 so that the 
name doesn't conflict), then add this library as the FIRST required 
library for your project.
2. Modify the existing JUnit library in JBuilder.  You can either change 
the library definition (make it pointing to the new library), or 
overwrite the existing junit.jar and src.jar in JBuilder with version 3.8

Shane
